definition: see 推陳出新|推陈出新[tui1 chen2 chu1 xin1]
to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage
surname Chen/Chen (c. 1045 - 479 BC), a Zhou dynasty state/Chen (557-589), one of the Southern Dynasties 南朝[Nan2 Chao2]
to lay out/to exhibit/to display/to narrate/to state/to explain/to tell/old/stale
to send/to devote/to deliver/to cause/to convey
(bound form) fine/delicate
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
new/newly/meso- (chemistry)
to alleviate fever (medicine)/to clear internal heat (Chinese medicine)
to dispel blood stasis (TCM)
to relieve (cold, rheumatic pain etc)/lit. to dispel pathogenic wind (TCM)
to have diarrhea
dried fruit of immature citron or trifoliate orange (used in TCM)
stagnation of 氣|气[qi4] (TCM)
to improve blood circulation (Chinese medicine)
hematoma (internal blood clot)/extravasated blood (spilt into surrounding tissue)/contusion
orderly and logical (of writing)/luxuriant/flourishing/prosperous
lienteric diarrhea (TCM)
(TCM) the three truncal cavities (thoracic, abdominal and pelvic), known as the "triple heater" or "San Jiao"
edema (accumulation of interstitial fluids in internal organs)/dropsy
wuling powder (decoction of poria mushroom used in TCM)/poria five powder/Hoelen five powder/five ling powder
reverse flow of 氣|气[qi4] (TCM)
benefit/help

(TCM) six bowels (hollow organs), namely: gall bladder 膽|胆[dan3], stomach 胃[wei4], large intestine 大腸|大肠[da4 chang2], small intestine 小腸|小肠[xiao3 chang2], triple heater 三焦[san1 jiao1], bladder 膀胱[pang2 guang1]
